casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Eduardo IRVIN, a.k.a. Marc Jean Phillipe, a.k.a. Wayne Alfanso Wilmot, Defendant-Appellant. No. 06-12820

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. Aug. 2, 2007. Eduardo Irvin, Coral Springs, FL, pro se. Patricia D. Barksdale, Jacksonville, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Before BIRCH, BARKETT and PRYOR, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

Lynn Palmer Bailey, appointed appellate counsel for Eduardo Irvin, has filed a motion to withdraw on appeal, supported by a brief prepared pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Irvin’s conviction and sentence are AFFIRMED.
